snippet: Responding to a report that found he had overstated the cost of a tunnel, Gov. Chris Christie told prominent Republicans in Manhattan that scrapping the plan had been a matter of principle.
abstract: Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey defends his cancellation of commuter train tunnel planned to relieve increasing congestion across the Hudson River; says that decision to cancel was a matter of principle based upon his beliefs at the time that the project would cost New Jersey taxpayers billions of dollars in overruns.
lead_paragraph: Responding to a report that found he had overstated the cost of a tunnel, Gov. Chris Christie told prominent Republicans in Manhattan that scrapping the plan had been a matter of principle.

headline.seo: Christie Stands by His Decision to Cancel Trans-Hudson Tunnel
headline.main: Christie Stands by His Decision to Cancel Train Tunnel
headline.print_headline: Christie Stands by His Decision to Cancel Train Tunnel
